admreg: Middle East and North Africa,Middle East and North Africa

abstracts.cdata!:
This is the Implementation Completion
            Report (ICR) for the Second Rural Electrification Project in
            Morocco. The overall outcome of the project was rated
            marginally satisfactory; the performance of the Banks was
            mixed; and the borrower performance is considered as
            deficient for compliance with covenants, and as marginally
            satisfactory for project implementation. The main objectives
            of the project were to: (a) expand electricity supply to the
            rural areas; (b) improve the reliability and quality of
            service of the existing rural distribution network; and (c)
            strengthen the administrative, planning, and financial
            capabilities in the power sector. The project was also
            expected to contribute to the Government's policy of
            improving the efficiency of energy consumption. The main
            lessons can be drawn from the project are as follows: (a) A
            rigorous economic analysis of the benefits of rural
            electrification can justify the relative high investment
            costs of a rural electrification project. In particular, the
            value of the consumer's surplus benefit needs to be
            carefully evaluated because it plays a key role in the
            economics of the project. In this case the value of the
            consumer's surplus benefit is of the same order of
            magnitude of benefit proxied by the revenue yielded by the
            electricity tariffs. (b) Successful implementation of a
            rural electrification project requires that the government
            be fully committed to clear objectives and stable project
            financing and institutional arrangements. In the Moroccan
            project, the Government's hesitant commitment to two
            financing and institutional setups hampered and delayed
            project implementation.
